Question: While at Bowdoin, this person bet his friend Jonathan Cilley a bottle of Madeira wine that Cilley would get married before he did.
Hints: This person noted, "I am sick to death of Berkshire..
At the outset of the American Civil War, this person traveled with William D Ticknor to Washington, D.C.
This person admitted he had aged considerably, referring to himself as "wrinkled with time and trouble".
